commit_message:
Support edge mode

This patch enables to set QDR to edge mode. For more info please check:
https://qpid.apache.org/releases/qpid-dispatch-0.5/man/qdrouterd.conf.html

Change-Id: If9e3658d304c3071f53ecb1c42796d2603875fcd
(cherry picked from commit af35d35c5f131ff5f698b3752755b903b0fc0ee3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-qdr refs/changes/05/643905/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (optional) Operational mode for Router (standalone, edge or interconnected) validate_re($router_mode,'^(standalone$|edge$|interior$)')
deleted_lines: # (optional) Operational mode for Router (standalone or interconnected) validate_re($router_mode,'^(standalone$|interior$)')

commit_message:
Fix Mariadb replication config

This patch changes name of Mariadb binary and relay log files. From now
they start with 'mariadb' instead of 'mysql'. Thanks to this fact
binary log names on a master and slaves have same name and we avoid
mess in data directory once we promote one of slaves to the master.

Change-Id: I18823b7a78e07b7999c937d068fb9cce9ed00285
Co-Authored-By: Kasper Hasior <k.hasior@samsung.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/01/644901/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update master for stable/0.7.x

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/0.7.x.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/0.7.x.

Change-Id: I6e050c0995f4d7dc44481114d1041cfb13eb0b8e
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I7ff6e5e97fe6e3112b5a8ecb987462d41b992f56
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/castellan refs/changes/87/646087/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[WIP] emit release to support stein, account for upgrades

WIP ==> tests failing, need to review upgrade tests

Add support to stein branch and account for upgrades.
Bump tested releases to the next release and change long term
supported release to rocky.

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I74ffd167bea64e71feeb202f02625a6354dd5fa2

added_lines: class ResizeCluster(command.Command): _description = _("Resize a Cluster") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ResizeCluster, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'cluster', metavar='<cluster>', help=_('The name or UUID of cluster to update')) parser.add_argument( 'node-count', metavar='<node_count>', type=int, help=_("Desired node count of the cluser.")) parser.add_argument( 'nodes-to-remove', metavar='<ID1,ID2,ID3...>', action='append', default=[], help=_( "Server ID of the nodes to be removed.")) parser.add_argument( '--nodegroup', metavar='<nodegroup>', help=_('The name or UUID of the nodegroup of current cluster.')) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): self.log.debug("take_action(%s)", parsed_args) mag_client = self.app.client_manager.container_infra cluster = mag_client.clusters.get(parsed_args.cluster) mag_client.clusters.resize(cluster, parsed_args.node_count, parsed_args.nodes_to_remove, parsed_args.nodegroup) print("Request to resize cluster %s has been accepted." % parsed_args.cluster)

subject: Fix neutron rolling upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-21 10:26:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/d53c85c3f14c68d32ab68fc132c906cfa4084c97', 'message': "Fix neutron rolling upgrade

Services were being passed as a JSON list, then iterated over in the
neutron-server container's extend_start.sh script like this:

['neutron-server'
'neutron-fwaas'
'neutron-vpnaas']

To make matters worse, we don't have set -o errexit in the script, so it
ignores the error.

I'm not actually sure why we have to specify services explicitly, it
seems liable to break if we have other plugins that need migrating.

Change-Id: Ic8ce595793cbe0772e44c041246d5af3a9471d44
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-03-21 12:47:56.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/rolling_upgrade.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/55633ebf93c1105e7ac668e6edbba8edaf414584', 'message': "Fix neutron rolling upgrade

Services were being passed as a JSON list, then iterated over in the
neutron-server container's extend_start.sh script like this:

['neutron-server'
'neutron-fwaas'
'neutron-vpnaas']

I'm not actually sure why we have to specify services explicitly, it
seems liable to break if we have other plugins that need migrating.

Change-Id: Ic8ce595793cbe0772e44c041246d5af3a9471d44
"}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron rolling upgrade

Services were being passed as a JSON list, then iterated over in the
neutron-server container's extend_start.sh script like this:

['neutron-server'
'neutron-fwaas'
'neutron-vpnaas']

I'm not actually sure why we have to specify services explicitly, it
seems liable to break if we have other plugins that need migrating.

Change-Id: Ic8ce595793cbe0772e44c041246d5af3a9471d44
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/02/645102/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NEUTRON_ROLLING_UPGRADE_SERVICES: "{{ neutron_rolling_upgrade_services | join(' ') }}" NEUTRON_ROLLING_UPGRADE_SERVICES: "{{ neutron_rolling_upgrade_services | join(' ') }}"

subject: Fix Neutron precheck to not fail with newer Docker
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-22 18:48:46.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/precheck.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/90329984c82581e3345ce0a4f39d99902e2aa1a1', 'message': 'Fix Neutron precheck to not fail with newer Docker

With newer Docker versions `systemctl show docker` returns:

  MountFlags=shared

Instead of:

  MountFlags=1048576

This fix accepts either value as valid to ensure the check is not
erroneously failing.

Closes-Bug: #1791365

Change-Id: I2bd626466d6a0e189e0d85877b2be8f2b4bb37f4
(cherry picked from commit 958efcef73fe1bb4de7bc65b1535a0fefc6e7771)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Neutron precheck to not fail with newer Docker

With newer Docker versions `systemctl show docker` returns:

  MountFlags=shared

Instead of:

  MountFlags=1048576

This fix accepts either value as valid to ensure the check is not
erroneously failing.

Closes-Bug: #1791365

Change-Id: I2bd626466d6a0e189e0d85877b2be8f2b4bb37f4
(cherry picked from commit 958efcef73fe1bb4de7bc65b1535a0fefc6e7771)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/40/645840/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # In some systems MountFlags on the Docker service is set to 'shared', whereas # in others it's set to the decimal value of the 20th bit. This now checks for both # values. Either '1048576' or 'shared' will pass the precheck. failed_when: result.stdout.find('MountFlags=1048576') == -1 and result.stdout.find('MountFlags=shared') == -1

instance and volume in different availability zones.

commit_message:
Move tarball-base settings to repo settings

This moves existing tarball-base settings out of per-release to the
overall repository-settings. This is nearly always the same for every
release, so it's a little redundant, and having it as an overall setting
will cause it to be carried over when running init-series and prevent
the need to remember to add it with new releases.

Change-Id: I6f5766313a5484653b881cf75f8b3c76a473f3e9
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),

commit_message:
Try harder to find liberasurecode

Allow the use of LD_LIBRARY_PATH when finding shared libraries;
see https://bugs.python.org/issue9998 which was addressed in
Python 3.6

Change-Id: I45f89152f94ca1bf9a8f097fbe69521892d285fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pyeclib refs/changes/01/636501/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import errnoimport re import subprocessdef resolve_symlink(path): try: tgt = os.readlink(path) except OSError as e: if e.errno in (errno.EINVAL, errno.ENOENT): # not a link or doesn't exist; we're as far as we can go return path raise else: if not os.path.isabs(tgt): tgt = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(path), tgt) return resolve_symlink(tgt) elif not target_lib: # See https://bugs.python.org/issue9998 expr = r'[^\(\)\s]*lib%s\.[^\(\)\s]*' % re.escape(name) cmd = ['ld', '-t'] libpath = os.environ.get('LD_LIBRARY_PATH') if libpath: for d in libpath.split(':'): cmd.extend(['-L', d]) cmd.extend(['-o', os.devnull, '-l%s' % name]) result = None try: p = subprocess.Popen(cmd, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, universal_newlines=True) out, _ = p.communicate() if hasattr(os, 'fsdecode'): out = os.fsdecode(out) res = re.search(expr, out) if res: target_lib = res.group(0) except Exception as e: pass # result will be None return resolve_symlink(target_lib)

commit_message:
Use new Docker packages in Ubuntu 18.04+

Ubuntu 18.04 does not support the legacy Docker packages, so we might as
well be helpful with the default of docker_legacy_packages, to make the
default case work on that OS.

This is also necessary for implementing upgrade jobs in Stein which use
the Ubuntu bionic image.

Change-Id: I4d0bb21973dc77e40c40f9751c6eb3a040acdfb3
Related: blueprint docker-ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/16/645816/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ubuntu 18.04+ does not support the legacy packages, so use the new packages. # All other distros & versions use legacy packages by default in Rocky for # backwards compatibility. docker_legacy_packages: >- {{ ansible_facts.distribution != 'Ubuntu' or ansible_facts.distribution_version is version('18.04', 'lt') }}

subject: Upgrade test: add support for being the source release
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-21 10:01:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/a3377aa666c483eec64740af999b2cca0cf553bc', 'message': 'Upgrade test: add support for being the source release

commit_message:
Upgrade test: add support for being the source release

Rocky only.

In order to test upgrades from Rocky to Stein, we add support to the
test template for globals.yml to use the upstream rocky tagged images on
Dockerhub.

Change-Id: Iad1814e2c29023cc4ff7e0b387007cd2659fee29

commit_message:
Fix multiple issues

Multiple issues being fixed here.

1. The response code is 301 when get the
   rabbitmq_clusterer-3.6.x-667f92b0.ez with curl.  The rabbitmq source
   has changed http to https.

2. OracleLinux repos definition was changed in official image.

3. Percona started signing packages with a new public GPG key, without
   providing it via HTTPS. Ship the PERCONA-PACKAGING-KEY extracted from
   the percona-release package.

   https://jira.percona.com/browse/PT-1685

4. Horizon image is failing to build on centos/oracle binary due to
   a conflict between python2-django16 and python2-django. Workaround is
   to install openstack-dashboard separate from plugins.

Co-Authored-By: chenyaguang <chenyaguang@szzt.com.cn>
Change-Id: Ic0c4ad01607794f44a61448b002885cb33efea98
Related-Bug: #1813906

commit_message:
MariaDB upgrade: specify host and port

While mysql_upgrade seems to work on CentOS images without specifying a
host and port, it fails on Ubuntu without these.

Change-Id: Ie140de57c4fe2f2e4db6a90c18e3535d9cc71ff2
Related-Bug: #1820325

commit_message:
Wait for cinder volume to become available in CI

Fixes a race condition where sometimes a volume would still be in the
'creating' state when trying to attach it to a server.

Invalid volume: Volume <id> status must be available or downloading to
reserve, but the current status is creating.

Change-Id: I0687ddfd78c384650cb361ff07aa64c5c3806a93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/77/645277/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: attempt=1 while [[ $(openstack volume show test_volume -f value -c status) != "available" ]]; do echo "Volume not available yet" attempt=$((attempt+1)) if [[ $attempt -eq 10 ]]; then echo "Volume failed to become available" openstack volume show test_volume return 1 fi sleep 10 done

commit_message:
Be clear about failures

If there is a mirror problem it should be directly shown and fail
immediately.

Change-Id: Ic1dc64be2f4a82420ecf921d4c8bf4f773a6328c

commit_message:
Install trousers to get user tss for nova_libvirt

The user tss is wanted by libvirt and comes with the trousers package.
Prior RHEL8 it comes via the gnutls -> trousers dependencies, but there is
no such a dependency in RHEL8, so make sure we have trousers installed.

Change-Id: I9f11ba53d5c6f0a435a62bb462164566c4519d9f
Closes-Bug: #1821309
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/08/647308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | The user tss is wanted by libvirt and comes with the trousers package. Prior RHEL8 it comes via the gnutls -> trousers dependencies, but there is no such a dependency in RHEL8, so make sure we have trousers installed.

commit_message:
Remove usage of tempest test_l3_agent_scheduler

Tempest test 'test_l3_agent_scheduler' is going to be
removed from Tempest  - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/640767/

Same test exist in neutron-tempest-plugin[1], which can be used
if required.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/tree/neutron_tempest_plugin/api/admin/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py

Change-Id: Ib410e2253b06a8c405d8692753890863c0d494b3

commit_message:
Bump psycopg lower-constraint to 2.7

Earlier versions don't work with postgresql 10, which is now showing
up in distros.

Change-Id: I56589eb4ac55bec426d16f355398720f2994edcb
Closes-Bug: 1821400

commit_message:
Enable to open arbitrary tab on  Angular modal-form from action

For now, when openning dialog from action in Angularized table,
there is no way to open the arbitrary tab on the dialog.

This means we can not open the arbitrary tab directly from action
like the actions (e.g. Manage Member and Edit actions) on
Django-based users table.

This patch enables to open abitrary tab directly from actions.
To specify the tab to open, add "key" property into your tab setting
in form, e.g. config.form[0].tabs[2].key = "volumes", and set one of
the "key" property in your tabs into config.model.tabs.initialTabKey.

Change-Id: I380684c83984d0c2e3024610b13946d625731e6c
Closes-Bug: #1783256

commit_message:
Add Enable/Disable Domain action for Angular domains panel

This patch adds row action for enabling/disabling domain.
Other actions will be added in subsequent patches.

To test, set 'domains_panel': True in 'ANGULAR_FEATURES'.

And generally, to enable domain panel, we need to the setup below.
 - https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Horizon/DomainWorkFlow

Change-Id: I957d6d51e21d21c289ed59a9923264007b05695a
Implements: blueprint ng-domains

See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. */ (function() { 'use strict'; angular .module('horizon.dashboard.identity.domains') .factory('horizon.dashboard.identity.domains.actions.disable.service', disableService); disableService.$inject = [ '$q', 'horizon.dashboard.identity.domains.resourceType', 'horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.keystone', 'horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.policy', 'horizon.framework.util.actions.action-result.service', 'horizon.framework.util.q.extensions', 'horizon.framework.widgets.toast.service' ]; /** * @ngDoc factory * @name horizon.dashboard.identity.domains.actions.disable.service * @Description A service to disable the domain. */ function disableService( $q, resourceType, keystone, policy, actionResultService, $qExtensions, toast ) { var message = { success: gettext('Domain %s was successfully disabled.') }; var service = { allowed: allowed, perform: perform }; return service; ////////////// function allowed(selected) { return $q.all([ keystone.canEditIdentity('domain'), $qExtensions.booleanAsPromise(selected.enabled), policy.ifAllowed({ rules: [['identity', 'identity:update_domain']] }) ]); } function perform(selected) { return keystone.editDomain({id: selected.id, enabled: false}).then(success); function success() { toast.add('success', interpolate(message.success, [selected.name])); return actionResultService.getActionResult() .updated(resourceType, selected.id) .result; } } } })();

commit_message:
Add set-context and clear-context service for Angular domain panel

These services are for Set Domain Context and Clear Domain Context
actions. This actions swiching a domain context.

Also, show details view when Domain Context is set.

To test, set 'domains_panel': True in 'ANGULAR_FEATURES'.

And generally, to enable domain panel, we need to the setup below.
 - https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Horizon/DomainWorkFlow

Change-Id: If5be8903ee270433ee544f0cb295c7f6683d6615
Partially-Implements: blueprint ng-domains
Co-Authored-By: Shu Muto <shu.mutow@gmail.com>

added_lines: /** * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may * not use self file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain * a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT * WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. */ (function() { 'use strict'; describe('horizon.dashboard.identity.domains.actions.set-context.service', function() { var $scope, $q, keystoneAPI, policyAPI, settingAPI, sessionAPI, service; beforeEach(module('horizon.framework')); beforeEach(module('horizon.app.core')); beforeEach(module('horizon.dashboard.identity.domains')); beforeEach(inject(function($injector, _$rootScope_, _$q_) { $scope = _$rootScope_.$new(); $q = _$q_; keystoneAPI = $injector.get('horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.keystone'); policyAPI = $injector.get('horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.policy'); settingAPI = $injector.get('horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.settings'); sessionAPI = $injector.get('horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.userSession'); service = $injector.get('horizon.dashboard.identity.domains.actions.set-context.service'); })); describe('allowed', function() { it('should allow update_domain', function() { //for isCurrentDomain var deferredUserSession = $q.defer(); deferredUserSession.resolve({domain_context: '3456'}); spyOn(sessionAPI, "get").and.returnValue(deferredUserSession.promise); //for ifMultiDomainSupport var deferredIfMultiDomainSupport = $q.defer(); deferredIfMultiDomainSupport.resolve(true); spyOn(settingAPI, 'getSetting').and.returnValue(deferredIfMultiDomainSupport.promise); //for ifAllowed var deferredIfAllowed = $q.defer(); deferredIfAllowed.resolve(true); spyOn(policyAPI, 'ifAllowed').and.returnValue(deferredIfAllowed.promise); var allowed = service.allowed({id: '1234'}); $scope.$apply(); expect(allowed).toBeTruthy(); expect(policyAPI.ifAllowed).toHaveBeenCalledWith( { rules: [['identity', 'update_domain']] }); }); it('should not allow update_domain', function() { //for isCurrentDomain var deferredUserSession = $q.defer(); deferredUserSession.resolve({domain_context: '1234'}); spyOn(sessionAPI, "get").and.returnValue(deferredUserSession.promise); //for ifMultiDomainSupport var deferredIfMultiDomainSupport = $q.defer(); deferredIfMultiDomainSupport.resolve(false); spyOn(settingAPI, 'getSetting').and.returnValue(deferredIfMultiDomainSupport.promise); //for ifAllowed var deferredIfAllowed = $q.defer(); deferredIfAllowed.resolve(false); spyOn(policyAPI, 'ifAllowed').and.returnValue(deferredIfAllowed.promise); var allowed = service.allowed({id: '1234'}); $scope.$apply(); // reject expect(allowed.$$state.status).toEqual(2); }); }); describe('perform', function() { it('should call keystone.setDomainContext', function() { var domain = {data: {id: '1234', name:'switched domain'}}; var deferred = $q.defer(); deferred.resolve(domain); spyOn(keystoneAPI, "setDomainContext").and.returnValue(deferred.promise); service.perform(domain); $scope.$apply(); }); }); }); })();

git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I468f696e9be3949b705d64cd22b02a0146f5fb41
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/80/646880/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add Edit domain action in angular

This patch adds edit domain action.
Other actions will be added in subsequent patches.

To test, set 'domains_panel': True in 'ANGULAR_FEATURES'.

And generally, to enable domain panel, we need to the setup below.
 - https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Horizon/DomainWorkFlow

Change-Id: I3990ca92a4a0d437d3ce71ccb82a463485eb4c36
Partially-Implements: blueprint ng-domains

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

subject: network topology: handle port AZ correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-21 19:46:52.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/js/horizon.networktopology.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/273de58cccfd7c82dbe7372b7c8a7d9d9dd39b06', 'message': "network topology: handle port AZ correctly

Previously d3 version of the network topology view handles ports with
device_owner 'compute:nova' and 'compute:None' specially. This leads
to the situtaion that neutron ports with non-default AZ are not shown
properly. There is no reason to handle neutron ports with the default
AZ differently. What we would like to do is just to classify neutron
ports attached to nova servers.

This commit changes the logic to check device_owner of ports have
a prefix 'compute:'. Note that we also need to check if device_owner
is a string before checking the prefix.

Change-Id: I472bae9af3d14d8a31efcae8a7610b84c4f09c3d
Closes-Bug: #1820260
(cherry picked from commit ffbe0e2f2f96556f4476ea3873af1bc628c879ca)

commit_message:
network topology: handle port AZ correctly

Previously d3 version of the network topology view handles ports with
device_owner 'compute:nova' and 'compute:None' specially. This leads
to the situtaion that neutron ports with non-default AZ are not shown
properly. There is no reason to handle neutron ports with the default
AZ differently. What we would like to do is just to classify neutron
ports attached to nova servers.

This commit changes the logic to check device_owner of ports have
a prefix 'compute:'. Note that we also need to check if device_owner
is a string before checking the prefix.

Change-Id: I472bae9af3d14d8a31efcae8a7610b84c4f09c3d
Closes-Bug: #1820260
(cherry picked from commit ffbe0e2f2f96556f4476ea3873af1bc628c879ca)

commit_message:
network topology: handle port AZ correctly

Previously d3 version of the network topology view handles ports with
device_owner 'compute:nova' and 'compute:None' specially. This leads
to the situtaion that neutron ports with non-default AZ are not shown
properly. There is no reason to handle neutron ports with the default
AZ differently. What we would like to do is just to classify neutron
ports attached to nova servers.

This commit changes the logic to check device_owner of ports have
a prefix 'compute:'. Note that we also need to check if device_owner
is a string before checking the prefix.

Change-Id: I472bae9af3d14d8a31efcae8a7610b84c4f09c3d
Closes-Bug: #1820260
(cherry picked from commit ffbe0e2f2f96556f4476ea3873af1bc628c879ca)

subject: network topology: handle port AZ correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-22 05:35:55.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/js/horizon.networktopology.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/94bf61662c43e484d878267962019c076a6a8b7b', 'message': "network topology: handle port AZ correctly

Previously d3 version of the network topology view handles ports with
device_owner 'compute:nova' and 'compute:None' specially. This leads
to the situtaion that neutron ports with non-default AZ are not shown
properly. There is no reason to handle neutron ports with the default
AZ differently. What we would like to do is just to classify neutron
ports attached to nova servers.

This commit changes the logic to check device_owner of ports have
a prefix 'compute:'. Note that we also need to check if device_owner
is a string before checking the prefix.

Change-Id: I472bae9af3d14d8a31efcae8a7610b84c4f09c3d
Closes-Bug: #1820260
(cherry picked from commit ffbe0e2f2f96556f4476ea3873af1bc628c879ca)
"}]
commit_message:
network topology: handle port AZ correctly

Previously d3 version of the network topology view handles ports with
device_owner 'compute:nova' and 'compute:None' specially. This leads
to the situtaion that neutron ports with non-default AZ are not shown
properly. There is no reason to handle neutron ports with the default
AZ differently. What we would like to do is just to classify neutron
ports attached to nova servers.

This commit changes the logic to check device_owner of ports have
a prefix 'compute:'. Note that we also need to check if device_owner
is a string before checking the prefix.

Change-Id: I472bae9af3d14d8a31efcae8a7610b84c4f09c3d
Closes-Bug: #1820260
(cherry picked from commit ffbe0e2f2f96556f4476ea3873af1bc628c879ca)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/75/645475/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Slightly reorder member flows

The pool should be marked active before the LB/Listener, because the LB
status is what locks the LB. Everything should be finished before that
status is unlocked.

Change-Id: I4c9916aff1b1f73f183ac98faee49a074ba28c90

rehome model_query function

Also see: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1815827
